comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: an unusual looking pre-dreadnought, laid down for Chile as Constitución for the South American arms race; sold to Britain to prevent falling into Russian hands, renamed HMS Swiftsure on 7 December 1903

comment.author: 83226190@N00
comment._content: My great uncle served aboard this vessel as an able seaman from 1903

comment.author: 41605996@N03
comment._content: My dad was aboard a HMS Swiftsure in the 1950's, not sure if it was this one though.

comment.author: 83226190@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/41605996@N03] 

Ray it would probably be this one - have a closer  look

comment.author: 41605996@N03
comment._content: cheers , very interesting, I had no idea that this ship had a collision and so many casualties, i wish my father was alive to ask him about it.
